description:
Bond Bar is a great local spot for a weeknight drink in the Mission. I went there were two friends last night and the staff were super helpful. I had a very tasty gin cocktail (the Walk in the Park, I think), and my friends got white wine that actually benefited Planned Parenthood.

They also have a huge projector display on one of the walls which is great for Warriors games, and it's right next to tons of other bars and food spots on 16th street. Would highly recommend.
author: David M.

description:
One of those bar hopping bars when in the Mission! 

Nice cocktails and specials on drinks during happy hour times! 

Get your drink on!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Fun ambiance for a evening out with friends.

With a wide open space, Bond is definitely inviting. However, tables for large groups can be limited-- our squad of 5 had to pull up multiple chairs to a small side table to make do. While not ideal, its acceptable as the overall bar was relatively empty still.

Drinks were decent and the music loud. If you want to have ~deep conversation~, this is not the place. Casual conversation though is a different story.

Overall a good pit stop in your evening bar hop, but nothing stood out.
author: Angela C.

description:
I like the Bond bar. 

Been here twice. Once for an event and once on a date. The backroom has a cool vibe with a huge projector. Drinks are good! I tried two different cocktails. Both were delish. 

Lots of great food spots nearby and super close to BART. I'll be back!
author: Angela F. W.

description: I came here on a Thursday evening for some drinks. It's conveniently located near 16th Bart, which makes it easily accessible. I stuck with my go-to Jameson and Gingerale for the night at the bar. The bartenders were super friendly and they even offered some Chex Mix to munch on too!
author: Cindy Z.

description: I like this place. Always a good time. Drinks are tastefully done, ambiance is perf. Manny is great, too. :)
author: Addi A.

description:
Very fun cool bar. Absolutely delicious unique drinks.
Loved the ambience, lighting and had plenty of seating! Definitely worth checking out
author: Aman K.

description:
Came to this bar on a Saturday night with a couple of friends after getting dinner in the area and saw they you could redeem a free drink with Hooch here. A little more than half of the seats were taken at 9 pm when we came, but we were able to find three seats to sit together at the bar.

Two of us started off with the Hooch negroni and penicillin, and another one of us got a pisco drink off the menu. The negroni was just as expected and penicillin was good, but a little too sweet for my taste. Surprisingly, the one pisco drink we paid for in the round was the one that tasted the worst - it basically had no taste with a hint of cinnamon.

The next round was better for all of us; I got the tamarind margarita special and asked the bartender not to make it too sweet, so it was a good balance of sweetness and tartness. I can't remember what the rest of my party ordered, but it was all pretty good.

The bartenders were pretty nice and the vibe was cool. They even brought out small bowls of Chex mix at the bar if that's what you're into while drinking!
author: Samira I.

description: I came to bond after dinner with a group of coworkers. We met up with two other dinner groups for a mega-meetup over drinks. We took over the whole back area which Bond had reserved for us. This was great for our group because otherwise, it would have been impossible for us to all get drinks going up to the bar. I was part of the first group to arrive so we instantly started into the cocktail list. By the time we left I may have had half of them... oops! All the drinks I tried were excellent and very creative. The staff was very accommodating to our large group and we all seemed to have a great time and plenty of drinks. I look forward to coming back with just a friend or two and hang at the bar for a while.
author: Scotty C.

description:
If you're in the mission, this is a great bar! They have yummy cocktails, it's not too crowded, and they have a back area with tables that you can make reservations for. I just love bars that allow reservations. 

The bar has a laidback vibe and is good for lounging if you're looking for a place to get delicious cocktails and catch up with a few friends.
author: Mai Y.

description:
I found my new favorite bar and favorite drink. Hibiscus Bliss with vodka. YUM! Shout out to bartender Canada. She did a great job making my drink and also making it look pretty. She was great!

Too bad its ways far away from home but I will be visiting whenever I'm in the mission. The environment was great. Not sure how things are late nights but great atmosphere after work. Good amount of spaces to sit and chill before going to dinner. Huge TV in the back and $20 minimum for credit card.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Love this bar! Been here a million times and always recommend it to everyone. It's the perfect low key cocktail bar. There's almost always a place to sit despite it always being busy. Its magic! 

Manuel is the best bartender, super friendly and quick. They have a great cocktail menu and happy hour! Love the dark atmosphere and the huge screen. Last time I was there they were playing a nature documentary but I've seen sports played on it too. I've also seen the lounge area turn into a dance floor. Bond can be anything you want it to be!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Killer cocktails in a laid back atmosphere (that still exudes high class).

Oh Bond, I wish you posted your drink menu on your website so I could call out what I drank the night I visited you. When I'm socializing at a bar the last thing I want to do is say hold on, let me take down the name of this cocktail. I got a drink with egg white because egg whites make every drink creamy and delicious (seriously, I've never had a bad drink that contains egg white, but then again the bars that usually serve egg white drinks are usually into their craft. Ain't nobody got time for food poisoning if they do it wrong!) 

I also tried their spicy margarita. Mainly because I was socializing and wasn't going to take the time to pour over their drink menu again (which is worth pouring over if you have the time). Their spicy margarita is solid. It has the right amount of kick and this is coming from someone who hates spice.

The bartenders handle a large group well and it wasn't too busy for a Tuesday night. (I seriously don't understand how bars in San Francisco are busy on Tuesday nights, but that may be the old person Tampa Bay resident in me. Here, however, it wasn't packed until we showed up with a hoard of people).

It is a dark bar, but you can still see who you are talking to. There is a large space in the back with seating if you do come with a bigger group.

Overall I enjoyed this place and would recommend it to someone looking for a low-key night of craft cocktail drinking.
author: Christina G.

description:
My most recent visit was with a group of ten coworkers. I made a reservation through Yelp and Andrea replied promptly. 

The drinks here are so creative and tasty. The bartending staff is really friendly and can tweak drinks to accommodate your personal preferences. My favourite drink of the night was the one with lavender... it actually had real lavender infused in it! The presentation of their drinks are on point and everything I tasted on their menu was delicious. It was a great happy hour spot and I'd definitely book another event here again. Thanks Bond team!
author: Heather N.

description:
Super cute local bar with a funky flair. Great lighting and design. Good cocktails. There could be more seating in the back - I feel like the area with couches is a missed opportunity to create a really groovy lounge setting. With lamps, couches and more. Right now it just feels kind of empty. 
Loved the music and the bartenders were friendly. Will definitely go back.
author: Terri L.

description:
If I were the owner, or even a bartender here, I'd kick anyone out that ordered a martini shaken, not stirred. For one, don't go for the obvious joke. If you want to reference James Bond movies that's fine, but at least show a little creativity, ya?

The real reason to kick them out, though, is these guys sling a nice enough cocktail that they don't need some knucklehead telling them how to make their drinks. Sure, you could probably order a martini but let them make it without you micromanaging. Trust they know their craft. Side note: I've always thought it's funny that Bond orders his martini shaken; sure it might have a smoother flavor, but he's all kinds of arrogant about having them shake it, which is only going to chip the ice and make it melt faster, thus watering down the drink faster.

It's a little dark, a little loud, but honestly, very tolerable in the volume and ambiance category. I'm not a drinker, so ambiance is especially important and when I need to go with a bunch of coworkers to a place, I'm very relieved when I don't have to shout. It wasn't the loudest here, so we could still have a conversation.

The report on the specialty cocktails is good. This being SF I always get a little sticker shock on craft cocktails, but it's perfectly in line with the city's prices. Plus you can ask about specials or see about well drinks and save a few nickels.

Fun visit, good convos, and I was able to duck out after a few and enjoy the rest of what the neighborhood had to offer.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Did the bar get its name from the guy parked outside with the N64 on his roof playing Golden Eye?

Probably not, but it's fun to think it's possible! 

Bond is dark, loud, and maybe a bit hot, but what they were low on in the ambiance department was more than made up by the super friendly and attentive staff, working hard to sling drinks to the large crowd seated at the VERY long bar! 

The cocktail menu is concise, but there's absolutely something for everyone on there. I enjoyed a riff on a Manhattan that was damn good, and while I usually like those drinks up, this one was served over, and Bond gets bonus points for that being over a big ol' cube. 

The fact that this is the default for so many SF bars still surprises me, but I guess it shouldn't. I mean, they all have a craft cocktail menu, their whiskey selections, while small, can certainly rival all I regularly encounter, and the staff always seems to know their stuff, which adds up to the fact that these are pretty legit bars with legit clientele who demand a certain standard.

It's pretty refreshing to see neighborhood bars NOT cutting corners in SF. If you're going to be paying the prices, you have a right to expect them to go the extra mile.

Bond did not disappoint at all.
author: Michael T.

description: Great service. Lovely atmosphere. Staff was super accommodating. Great drinks as well. Just awesome.
author: Ace G.

description:
Came here because it's right next to my favorite taqueria in the Mission District. I thought it would be more artisanal cocktail drinks, but felt more college, dive bar-ey. It still hangs with the Mission scene though

Projector in the back showing re-runs of the same scenery. Tables and chairs look like it would be table service at a club. It's fairly empty the couple of times I went.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Came here for a few drinks the other night. Be prepared to have your table swooped on if you don't have someone watch it. I ordered The Don (one of the many cocktails you can order from their menu). Not bad a little still. Ordered McCallans rocks too for $13. They were showing the Warriors game on the projection screen to the back and then switched to a screen saver later on. Love the lounge feeling you get towards the back. Also loved they were playing chillout music like Flume and Odesza. Not too loud so you can have a conversation without yelling.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Why 4 stars? Because I'm normally not a huge cocktail bar fan, but I enjoyed Bond.

   ---   ---   ---

You'll sooner find me at a beer bar than one that primarily serves cocktails, but there was a small/decent beer list here, which I took advantage of. I also liked the vibe in Bond, in that, it wasn't super hectic/loud with long wait times to get the attention of the bartenders. It was a very chill and relaxed atmosphere, with friendly and attentive bartenders.

We were in a very large group of colleagues that ascended onto Bond on a Tuesday night. Maybe that's why it wasn't too crazy in there, because it was a Tuesday? Regardless, the folks of Bond handled our group like champions. More and more people kept pouring in (from our group and outsiders as well) but said bartenders remained just as available and just as friendly.

Next time, I'll try out one of their specialty cocktails, but I enjoyed my first visit.
author: Brett N.

description:
Spent my last day in SF in "The Mission", this was one of the spots  I checked out.
Sf has alot of cocktail bars and this place hangs with the rest. This spot is low key, it was a little empty but it was also like 5pm on a Sunday. The bartender made a great ol fashioned and sazerac, so I was happy. Wish they played music videos or something on that large screen, instead of images that remind me of microsoft screensavers.
author: AJ M.

description: walked by here so many times, thinking I'll stop in one day and finally did. so glad I did, and annoyed it took so long. very chill inside, not super crowded after work and the bartenders are awesome. lots of whisky and rye choices as well as other spirits. comfortable seating away from the bar too. probably won't walk by many more times without stopping in
author: Bob U.

description:
Ambiance here is way more upscale and chill. Don't need to yell in order to be heard. Plenty of seating in the back and very comfortable. 

Cocktails here were $11. I had a pisco, cinnamon, egg white drink that was fantastic. I'd highly recommend it as it was smooth and very easy to drink. Drinks were very easy to order from the bar and I'm surprised this place isn't more popular. 

Music here was mostly rock and my friend loved it.
author: Edward W.

description: Deceiving photos... this is a low key dive bar with the only area that looks nice (tables) reserved...
author: Millennium S.

description:
Came here for a friend' birthday as he booked the back area for his event. I'm not sure how private it was since I didn't see any "reserved" sign or anything and it seemed like almost anyone can walk into that area especially since the bathroom was back there.

Anyways, it's a pretty cool upscale bar in the Mission. It's very dimly lit and I felt lame using a candle/phone light to read the cocktail menu. It's a cool social spot though it get's pretty loud in there to carry a serious conversation. Drinks (at least the cocktail I got) was good, but be ready to pay SF prices for it.

Overall, a cool spot and a good night.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Giving it 4 stars only because on the outside this place looks a bit sketch, but once you're in you won't walk out. Great drinks, nice seating, and never too packed to the point of congestion. This is a nice spot to start off at if you're in the mission and head over to Blondies or wherever else when you're in the mood for dancing or the party scene.
author: Paul H.

description:
Bond is one of my favorite bars in SF.

Amazing vibe, even better music, and great drinks.

This is a review I can keep short and sweet -- there's nothing more to elaborate on.

Now, go!
author: Nic Z.

description: Amazing bar with an awesome atmosphere and the perfect balance of well priced, well made cocktails. They also had a great selection of whiskeys and mezcals that were all priced reasonably. Might be a little tricky to find a good seat on busy nights, but just be a little patient and some will open up.
author: Casey M.

description: We went on a slow Monday but our bartender (female covered in tattooed) recommended some other spots in SanFran. She made us come yummy cucumber gimlets with little sugar.
author: Monique W.

description:
Bond has been on my bookmark list for ages, but with a 4 pm opening time on weekends, it can be a little hard to squeeze them into my schedule. Finally made it out at opening on a Saturday afternoon, and was pretty disappointed.

THE OVERVIEW.
- Very limited parking (but I mean, it's the Mission)
- Not super walkable location-wise (but again, it's the Mission)
+ Friendly bartender and unique interior
- Over-priced, incredibly average drinks, no matter how fun they may come across in their menu

I would not make the mistake of coming here again.
author: Claire S.

description:
Tank 7 on draft +1
Comfy seats toward the back good for groups +1
$5 well hh +1 
Free bar snacks +1

Overall Thoughts

Bond bar is a great spot to be
author: Eddie W.

description: Trendy yet classic cocktail bar. Quick walk from the hot mission dining spots, with enough people to feel you're still hip, but enough space where you're not forced to socialize with strangers. But if that's your thing, seems like a decent place to meet some new, interesting characters. The clubby music, fancy - yet accessible - cocktails, cozy seating and projected jellyfish footage make this a comfortable but cool spot to be at 9:30 on a Friday night.
author: Mark D.

description:
Bond has a huuuuge TV in their lounge area at the back. Quality is very clear. Lounge area is nice too. 

Music was not too loud; you didn't have to yell to the person next to you, which was nice since a lot of places really turn up their music. It's a nice place to have drinks and chill. 

I didn't order any drinks because I was DD but I did try a sip of my friend's Moscow Mule (since all my friends know I don't like it, but they told me Bond's Moscow Mules are good). They were right - it was good lol. Next time when I'm not DD, I'm down to try their drinks.
author: Bonnie N.

description:
A girlfriend and I were the only two who wanted to keep drinking after brunch, so we decided to do a Mission crawl of sorts. Bond was our second stop. We walked in on Saturday, September 3rd around 4:15pm. There were only a few people sitting at the bar, so we easily grabbed two seats.

*Tiger's milk: california peppers infused in barsol pisco, ginger gomme syrup, fresh lime, cilantro ($11)
*Basil franciscan: el silencio mezcal, reposado tequila, fresh basil & lemon, agave nectar, egg whites ($11)

I got the tiger's milk as I wanted something light and refreshing. It had the right amount of tartness with a kick from the peppers. Definitely a good sipping drink for me. Especially during the day. My gf wanted something with egg whites, so she got the basil franciscan. I'm normally not much of a tequila drinker, but this wasn't that bad. The fresh basil and lemon helped.

The bar area is beautiful. Pretty good selection of scotch and whiskey, which is normally my drink of choice. But with this day drink crawl, so I was keeping things light and sticking to cocktails. Our bartender was awesome. Very sweet and chill. We never had to flag him down.

Great cocktails! I'd love to come back and try some of their whiskey / rye based cocktails. I am a dark girl after all. Hehe!
author: Elena N.

description: Bond will always be one of my fave bars in The Mission. They have good cocktails and excellent service. Good for big parties as well (with reservations) Every time I go here, I always find bar seats, it gets crowded sometimes, but definitely manageable. I highly recommend this bar if you're in the area.
author: Gwen M.

description:
Beautiful and cool bar, highly recommend!

Music was Top 40 / EDM 

Came on a Saturday night around 10PM and it wasn't packed at all. Loved the ambience and inside of the bar. The bar itself was beautifully lit and had an arch that went across. The little lounge / sitting area had a cool projection backdrop. 

Definitely coming to Bond again when I'm back in SF.
author: Steve C.

description: Wandered into Bond last Friday when I was in the Mission area. Nice atmosphere with the continuous screensaver showing pics of the milky way on the back wall. Tried the Tiger's milk, dude in the mission and another rum based cocktail, all of them were excellent. Bartenders are great and its fun watching them mix drinks!
author: Sudipto G.

description: Pretty cool bar... there wasn't much alcohol in my strawberry gin gimlet.... barely a buzz. Their music was alright. Pretty crowded after 11pm. Would like to revisit sometime.
author: Ann L.

description: We wandered in here while looking for a bar that didn't have a cover charge and wasn't too crowded on a Friday night. We got a table which seated two but we were three people; not a big deal though. The atmosphere is really nice and is very intimate; makes it perfect for a date, especially since it wasn't too loud so you could still hear the other person. I got a whiskey ginger which was just okay, it wasn't the best one I ever had. It seemed kinda watered down. Not sure I'd come back but maybe if I'm looking for a place to chill with friends and grab a quick drink.
author: Pooja C.

description:
Was in last night and was having a good time until I went to the restroom and return (90 seconds or less) to find my nearly full drink had been cleaned up from the bar.

I left it near my party and was surprised to find it missing when I returned.  I asked the bartender who told me that if I didn't want my drink to be taken I needed to put a napkin on top of it when I stepped away to use the restroom.  It would have certainly been an interesting balancing act getting my napkin to sit on top of a wide-mouthed coupe glass with garnishes on the rim.

This is what I expect to find in a dive bar (or if the place is packed, which it certainly was not at 10pm on a Wednesday night) but I have to wonder how many people abandon an $11-$13 cocktail.  Hopefully their bar manager (Ashley W) will fix this.

After the bartender re-explained to me that my keeping my drink safe from the nearest drain was my responsibility, they did eventually offer to remake the beverage but at that point I asked for my party's check.

Besides this experience the venue is clean and interesting and the drinks are well made.
author: Nick B.

description: The bartenders are all terrible and talk to each other more than they help customers. At times on a Saturday night there were no bartenders on the floor, just barbacks. They charge you to use a credit card which is an ilegal practice. The cocktail recipes sound good, but are executed poorly by the miserable bar staff so they taste like flavor-aid. This is the kind of place that makes SF bar scene, female bartenders, and the Mission look bad.
author: Phoenix F.

description: The drinks here were pricey, but nothing that doesn't fall under the SF prices. Chris was such a wonderful bartender
author: Sherry Z.

description: Pretty cool bar that's not packed. Ample seating and cozy atmosphere. Not really much to say about this place since I didn't spend much time hear but it wasn't pretentious or stuff which is always appreciated. Clientele is younger and my laid back. Bartenders were also friendly when we went.
author: Angela T.

description: A bit pricy but not objectionably crowded or pretentious. I thought the strawberry gimlet didn't really add anything to what you'd get in a normal gimlet. The pour is pretty generous on the rail drinks, so while $9 for G&T is a bit steep, they give you quite a bit of the G.
author: Misha T.

description:
Very cool spot for a drink! Love the design...it's kind of like if someone put a futuristic spin on the Great Gatsby. It'll make sense once you're there, I swear. The coolest part of the place is this huge screen in the back that plays nature/space animations. It's not actually 3D, but it definitely had that feel. The music in the bar was very fitting and set an upbeat mood. 

Some friends and I stopped by at 11pm on a Friday night and it was super busy, but we were able to order drinks at the bar relatively quickly. They have a good selection of cocktails for $10, but we opted to get beers and luckily found seats. 

I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Emma W.

description: This place is okay.  For the atmosphere and the vibe, it's a great spot in the Mission.  Drinks can be hit or miss though.  I had the strawberry gimlet since it seemed like one of their more popular drinks, it was pretty sour.  Not at all what I had hoped for, not much of a gin presence at all.  Much closer to a sour of some kind.  Price-wise though, things are fairly reasonable here.  The other drink I had, which I can't recall was pretty good.  The place seems to be pretty busy on weekends, but not necessarily packed.  Worked out as a decent plan B.
author: Bryson L.

description:
We held an alumni event towards the back of Bond on 9/20/17 and had a fantastic experience. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant. They were able to provide us a custom drink menu for our event. They even turned the lights up for a quick group photo and turned the music down briefly for a nice group cheers. 

Thank you for being such a wonderful host for our special event!
author: Damian W.

description: I came here in a weeknight with some friends about midnight and it was such a nice experience! We sat for hours drinking beer and talking with the bartenders. Would highly recommend.
author: Hayley H.

description:
I like the place it's clean and nice but I'm disappointed that  I can have one of the best mojitos in town and then I go the next time expecting not the same but something close and I end up getting a drink that is so badly that I have to ask for another one thinking that maybe is going to be better ‍... like tonight the bartender was unhappy because I didn't like the drinks and I asked for my check.
I never refuse to pay I always pay even if I like or don't like the drinks. 
I hope that the bartender get on the same recipes and training and don't get offended if the customers comment about it.
author: Danny H.

description: Great spot! The drinks were presentable and tasted great. Service was good. The noise level was still bearable, allowing you to still able to hear your friends in conversation.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Hidden gem in the Mission - you'll walk by this place and see straight through to the back where they have these cool images projected on the back wall (very "transporting you to another place" kind of feel).

They're known for their cocktails here - aka the strawberry gimlet is a good choice which is served with an ice cube with a strawberry frozen in it. Very refreshing!

There didn't seem to be much seating (or square footage), but we were able to find a table along the entrance hallway. From the looks of it, the area/seats in the way back were packed!
author: Wing L.

description: Convenient location and cool space to be in--love the bar and the projector on the wall at the back. But their drinks are unbalanced and the service lacked the friendly, personable element I was expecting. It can get very crowded after a certain hour which means the service deteriorates even further. I might give it another try if I'm in the area but for now I don't see the draw of going back.
author: Yad L.

description: Some really creative and delicious cocktails that I haven't seen elsewhere.  Nice interior with plenty of space and seating, and good mix of music playing.
author: Sophia L.

description: What a classy spot! They offer a wide selection of  cocktails and drinks--they even carry a tasty sparkling wine! There is plenty of lounge seating to relax with friends and the bar stools are comfy! I've always had great service and I really need to visit this bar more often that I do!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
Great ambience and a place that knows how to make their Mezcal Drinks! 

Fun stop for game nights
author: Pranamee S.

description: For the drinks only the drinks I will give them 5/5. But the ruthless me will take away a point because they can surely be better at their service.
author: Milana R.

description:
TL;DR - Close enough to Bart and never too crowded.

They have a decent beers on tap and its not overly loud? Its kind of a confusing set up with the TV playing super random stuff. But its got less traffic than the other bars in the Mission so you won't have to fight anyone for seats or stuff haha.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Be transported into the Old San Francisco theater upon entering this lounge. It was actually a hotel that was remade into a bar, which gives you that old SF vibe that we love so much.  Just be aware that the bar is pretty small, but it's not that crowded.  So you can't even tell that it's a small venue.  

I would say the drink menu is pretty creative. They offer vodka, gin, tequila, mezcal, whiskey, rum, etc cocktails.  And they produce their own twist of the classic cocktails.  Whatever you're in the mood for, there's a drink for you.  They also incorporate fresh fruits/juices in the cocktail as well, which makes their drinks of high quality.  

Here are a couple that I tried.  
Erin wonderland: refreshing and tart with the grapefruit flavor. The thyme adds a nice to balance the drink.
Valencia Martinez: it's like a gin Manhattan. Or you can think of if it as a lighter and less sweet version of a negroni. Pretty interesting combination and twist to the classic drinks.

I'll be back whn I'm in the Mission district.
author: Shirley C.

description: I had only been here a few times before Brittany started working here, and my impressions were quite mixed. Now, it seems as if they have things dialed in with the drink menu. They also have the amazing Brittany! She really makes people happy with her shining personality and her quick wit!
author: Zachary T.

description: What an amazing find! Their drinks aren't outrageously expensive like many places in SF and the bartender, Ashely, was awesome! It also has a super seductive and sexy lounge area.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Had a great time at this bar on a Fri night! Nice ambiance, just the right amount of people, cocktails with fresh ingredients (and decently priced), clean bathrooms, very close to BART. 

Only negative was my friend's backpack was stolen (or mistakenly taken) :( 
That definitely left a bitter taste afterwards even though we had been standing by it all evening.
author: Yin H.

description:
I actually really liked the decor and feel of this place. Bond--super nice and super chill. It's very loungey and they have a good selection of beers and cocktails. Opted for a beer this time around but definitely want to try some of their cocktails. 

It has a slight elegance and nice decor that is not overly presumptuous and is still very inviting. I definitely want to check it out in the night-time. We came during a Sunday afternoon and still had a nice time!
author: Natalie M.

description:
The name's Bond.

Sorry, I can't resist movie references because I know so little of them :P

Anyways, the review:

[THE IMPRESSION]

We were wandering around the Mission and everywhere seemed either too crowded or too sketchy. At first we were hesitant about Bond because it seemed too nice, but it turned out to be nice while remaining reasonably priced at $10 per cocktail.

[THE CRAFTINESS]

There is a decent variety of cocktails, and they were well crafted. Bonus star for the extra flair in presentation: star anise frozen in an ice cube, a flamboyant twig of rosemary, a lemon slice of perfect radial symmetry, and an L-shaped floral sprig (though the L kept making me think that I was drinking a latte). 

[THE AMBIANCE]

It's hip without being too hip: a back area lit primarily by the glowing purple stained-glass tables, the spaciously minimalist arrangement that appears more like SJ than SF because you get too used to seeing densely packed layouts, and the large projector on the back wall which gives an overall lively feel (though I guess scenery isn't as hip as say, the black-and-white movie trailers projected at the Alchemist) 

[THE VERDICT]

I liked it! Bond is perhaps not as ratchet as what you'd come to the Mission for; rather it's more SoMA-esque (actually reminded me a lot of Singlebarrel in Downtown SJ). But then again, since it is located in the Mission you can sound ratchet in telling people you went to bars in the Mission, without having to deal with ratchet bars of the Mission. And yes, I hate the word ratchet too but it is just too fitting of a word choice.
author: Edna C.

description:
Great place. Not overly crowded and not over-priced, however it's sketchy outside, we almost passed on the place. 

Come with a group of friends!
author: Angelica C.

description:
Bond was close by to where my boyfriend and I were staying on our weekend trip to San Francisco. Given, we came in on a Tuesday night, so it wasn't very crowded, but for a week day, it was actually pretty busy.

The set up is very narrow, like a bar tucked away on a side street, which is ...exactly what it is. When you walk in, you have the entire bar to your right, and stools lined up. Towards the back, you have a few couches, and a large banquet table that divide the men and women's restrooms.

We went here with a few friends, grabbed a few seats at the couches. It wasn't too loud, so we were able to have conversation across without difficulty. The ambience is dark, moody, exactly how I like my cocktail lounges. It's a great spot to grab drinks with a date before or after dinner. Service is pretty good, fast on the drinks, too and prices are not bad. 

Definitely got the local feels here. Was a great first stop on our night out.
author: Joanna H.

description:
Love the plain gimlets here - not a huge fan of the strawberry ones since it tasted too sweet/artificial. They also have staff that can serve your table CARAFES of gimlets... amazing!!!

This place is awesome bc you can sit down, and hear each other relatively well -- but not feel like you're going to get trampled or spilled on. 

Perfect amount of foot traffic, good crowd, my kind of place.
author: Kristie C.

description: Super classy spot! Stopped by with my friends this weekend and it had a nice size crowd. The huge screen in the background played some pseudo planet earth imagery with a random galaxy in the background which was highly amusing. The music was very nice which is a super plus. The reason for 3 starts is because I found it very frustrating how long it took to get a drink at the bar. I know busy nights means longer waits for everyone, but it kind of damper when the bartender literally helps everyone around but you. Hopefully if this won't be the case if I ever find myself back again.
author: Helen F.

description: Great spot. Very chill - nice lounge area to chill. Great great cocktails. Good music and a big screen showing some cool videos.
author: Aaditya D.

description:
Situation 
- Drinks with a buddy on Cinco de Mayo
- Ordered the Desperado and the Bonding Sazerac
- Friend ordered the "The Dude" in the Mission and The Chili Chavez

Pros
- Extremely tasty cocktails 
- Fantastic service
- Great music

Cons
- Maybe the people loitering outside, but easy to Uber/Lyft/Sidecar or walk around the corner to Valencia
author: Dipesh G.

description: Meh. I went here on a bad/awkward first tinder date and it was kind of appropriate. Conveniently located but unremarkable and bland place where the bartenders measure everything. It gives every appearance of being fun and hip without actually being so. That said, the prices for drinks are fair.
author: Mary S.

description: The cocktails were awesome!! pepper on top of martini.. will not ever forget this place! It's a great spot for a date!
author: Aashka S.

description:
Bond is a great neighborhood bar. They have solid drinks and a great menu. No food. 

Atmosphere - regular bar in the front with seating and bottle service/lounge type seating towards the back. They have a huge wall that they project beautiful nature videos on constantly. They are amazing and actually interesting to watch. All of the servers are very nice and awesome. Nice glassware too.

Reservations - you can reserve a spot online through Yelp for a table for no charge. Great for birthdays when you want to sit together, but don't want to buy bottle service. 

I love their martini, cheers : )
author: Juliet S.

description:
Located in the old Esta Noche location, Bond recreates a warm, yet modern space.  Perch yourself at the vintage, carved-wood bar, or lounge in the back on angular couches by the large, wall-sized tv screen.

Creative cocktails are in fashion.  Bond delivers.  Sip down the runway in chill style!
author: Sondra H.

description:
Very nice and swanky bar. Great bartenders and delicious cocktails! 

Prices for drinks are not bad at all. 

I shall return on my next visit to SF!
author: Julie S.

description:
Stumbled across this bar while visiting San Francisco for my birthday. 

We visited on a Monday night and pretty much had the place to ourselves. I really enjoyed the vibe. The bartender was great and made some extra special cocktails for us. We indulged in the gin mixed drinks which were pricey but well made.

Wish we found this place sooner. Will definetly be back.
author: Keisha B.

description:
I don't usually write Yelp reviews but when I have an experience this poor, I need to share it.

The place is pretty, I'll give it that. The designers did nice job, if a tad lacking in personality. 

Drink menu was mediocre at best, nothing I was dying to try and what we finally settled on was not memorable and mostly all ice in the glass, leaving not much drink.

I recently wrote a friend who has been bartending for 20+ years in the city. He is the epitome of customer oriented, craft mixologist and knows his job inside and out. I was asking if he knew any great bartenders in need of a job, his response was:

"A lot of the young "mixologists" are too self important to be good bartenders. More emphasis on themselves than on customer service."

That explains Bond Bar's bartenders to a tee!! What has happened to customer service??

We went in around 8 on a Friday night, sat at bar and had THE WORST service I've ever gotten. Bartender was aloof, totally disinterested in answering questions about the cocktail list and then became condescending when she finally did answer. Bartenders stood around talking to one another rather than paying attention to guests. My date ordered a drink and I told bartender  I was going to try his first, to see if I wanted to order that, or something else. The moment he ordered she grabbed cocktail menu away. (? Um.. what about me?) His drink was boring, Ice packed and lacking in a balance if flavors. I definitely wanted something else but couldn't get a cocktail menu back to save my life. Nor could I get any service. The place had no more than 2 dozen patrons with 4 staff behind bar, yet none of them seemed to care less that I was trying to get service. Perfect opportunity to sell me something, even up sell me something, yet no one could be bothered. My date was so turned off by lack of service, lack of a decent drink and lack of an sort of interest or engagement from bar staff that he just wanted to leave. Thing is, we couldn't even get a check so we could leave! Finally, half hour to 45 minutes later we got a bartender, paid and left.

Here's the thing Bond Bar, in the hour we were there you could of easily sold us 4 drinks, a good bottle of wine or champagne, made the house some money and yourself a sizable tip. My date and I both worked as bartenders/waiters for many years and overtip every time. Instead, you sold us a single drink, made next to nothing for the house, and even though we still tipped you generously, we won't be back. Repeat service is the key to staying in business, and that, Bond  bartenders.. you failed at miserably!
author: JoAnna A.

description:
Went on a Sat night. Great music. Nice staff. Good drinks. Cool vibe. 
Con: some of my group got charged cover while others didn't (we all arrived from 10pm & on)...What's up with that!?
author: Rob M.

description: Made a reservation here for my wife's birthday drinks for a group of about 12 of us.  They were super responsive and easy to work with. It's a great spot for group drinks, would definitely be back!
author: Nick L.

description: The bartenders were super nice and the atmosphere was chill. Also has table at the back for larger groups.
author: Kurians P.

description: My cousin and I were out having a good time. Had a good buzz going. We tried to stop into Skylark on our Saturday evening adventure, but it was so busy. Bond was right next door and wasn't as packed. We got a great seat by the bar and looked through the cocktail book. I don't remember the name of the first drink I had, but it was their housemade horchata, either rum or tequila, and it was topped with cinnamon. It was a very strange drink and I wasn't much of a fan. I also don't remember the name of the second drink I had, but I remember really enjoying it and I believe it had strawberries in it. The cocktails my cousin got were super good too. It was a chill atmosphere, with a beautiful video playing of the SF skyline on the big screen. The bartenders were also really nice. I really enjoyed this bar.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Got to try their cocktails. Tonight was the watermelon 'slightly' spicy cocktail, wow wow   Super good!  Love the drinks there and vibe, super cool!
author: Sanj G.

description:
Pretty cool spot really close to BART, which makes it a convenient option. The drinks are good, but don't let the size of the glass deceive you for the cocktails because it's 75% ice. They do have a $20 minimum, so keep that in mind if you are just looking for a spot to grab a drink. The cocktail was good (again, except size), so wouldn't be the worst thing to get two anyways!

My main complaint is that it was so HOT in the bar the night that I went. Hot to the point where I had to finish my drink and leave because it was so stuffy. Drinking cocktails and sweating is not my ideal, so hopefully this was a one time thing! 

One plus side...plenty of spots to grab delicious Mexican food after drinks!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I came here on a Wednesday night and I instantly fell in love with the design of this bar. It wasn't overly crowded and the lounge in the back looked great for a group of people.

I will definitely go back if I am in the area. It is a convenient location if you have to catch Bart since it is right next to 16th Street station.
author: Michèle S.

description:
GREAT COCKTAILS and COOL VIBE.

My husband, a friend and I stopped into Bond Bar on Saturday around 7:30 for a cocktail between our early dinner and the birthday party we were headed to.  It was not crowded, but there were enough people it had a good vibe.  The decor is neat, and it is a typical dark cocktail bar.  The menu was easy to read and they had some creative drinks to choose from.  I did not actually go to the bar to order, but the men were back rather quickly with the drinks, so I have to assume the service was good. 

The three of us got the three mezcal drinks on the menu, and we were all very happy with them.  I got the mezcal and house-made horchata, which has since prompted me to go pick up a bottle of mezcal and find a horchata recipe, b/c it was AMAZING!!! My husband got the mezcal version of a manhattan and it was PERFECTLY blended.  Our friend got the refreshing mezcal drink with cucumber, and it tasted like the PERFECT drink for a hot day (even though it was a cold night...hehe).
author: Sarah F.

description:
One of my new favorite bars in the area, with a great ambiance, not-too-loud music, great drinks, not over-priced, and not overly crowded. To be fair, I came on a Sunday night during Pride, so take it my "not-too-crowded" comment with a grain of salt. I'm sure it gets busy on a Friday or Saturday night.

You can actually carry a conversation on, and the space is modern, clean, and tastefully decorated. The bar is really long and has maybe 15 seats, and there are couches and a big TV in the back. 

The drinks were really delicious and all reasonably priced at $10-12. I got a Strawberry Gin gimlet and then the bartender made me something off-the-menu with grapefruit and basil, which was delicious. 

The location is great, with lots of restaurants nearby if you want a bite to eat before or after, or if you want to grab dessert, CREAM is just down the street. If you like bars like Oddjob, Novela or Forgery in SOMA, without the steep prices, you'll like this bar. Looking forward to coming back here again and trying more of their drinks. Such a welcome addition to the neighborhood since some of the other bars in the area are a bit too dark or divey for my taste.
author: Christina L.

description:
My new favorite bar! The time lapse projected on the back wall is rad. I love that it echoes the artsy feel of the Mission District. Also, it was so nice that there were areas to sit down and that the drinks weren't overpriced! Only caveat is they do have a $20 minimum on credit card purchases so bring cash monayyyyy $$$

solid bar, great drinks, and trendy vibe!
author: Nicole W.

description: Conveniently located just a few hundred feet from 16th street BART.  Great selection of beers on tap and interesting cocktails.  Does have a $20 credit card minimum so keep that in mind if your just stopping in for A drink.
author: Aaron H.

description: My favorite bar in SF!  Best cocktails, which they change seasonally, super friendly bartenders, and also they play important warriors and giants games on the huge screen (when not playing awesome nature/space videos).  The decor is really cool with a staircase leading nowhere, original crown molding marquee, and a cool shuffleboard bar.  The ambiance is always super chill and the crowd is good.  Seating in the back is awesome and sometimes people are up dancing. I love coming here with friends.  PS: read the menu, it's got a cool history!
author: Heather T.

description:
I'm here now and I've been a bunch of times so far. Punchy music and a sexy vibe / ambiance for days. Plus they always have some gorgeous time lapse film playing on the back wall. Cocktails delicious. Wine pretty decent. Sweet art on the wall made of butterflies. Friendly bartenders.
I'm docking one star because sometimes the clientele can be douchey but not always. And when they are douchey, it's only some people, not all of them. I myself am not a douchebag so I can say that with confidence.
Definitely worth checking out the lively scene here!
author: Gillian K.

description:
Great lounge bar, location and high quality drinks.
Lots of interesting people and good vibes!
author: Federica S.

description: Nice, stylish bar with lots of space.  Great pineapple cider, and near BART.  Good service too.  However, their happy hour menu is only for $5 well drinks and $1 off all other drinks.
author: a f.

description:
Me and my friend literally passed by this place on the way to our original destination, and the little video on the wall definitely turned our heads, so we took a better look at the bar and decided to take a "pit stop" here for a first drink of the night. We ended up staying here for over an hour, never making it to our original destination and had an overall fantastic experience. 

We initially wanted well drinks but we didn't have cash and they only accept credit cards for purchases $20 or more so we opted for their cocktail drinks (avg $10-$11 each). Absolutely LOVED them... so glad I got the Oakland Sour over a measly old vodka and cranberry. You can tell the bartenders put a bit of care in their mixing. The Oakland Sour I'm assuming is their unique twist on a Whiskey Sour which is why I went for it. Like I said, I was clearly not at all disappointed. My friend went for the Strawberry Gin Gimlet, which I can tell from Yelp seems like a top seller. And yeah...probably owns up to it. I can tell it's on the stronger side but not in a bad way-- my friend really enjoyed it. We only hoped the strawberry infused ice cube could melt quick enough to get those juicy strawberry slices but it didn't melt fast enough.

Slick, simple ambiance. Great for long, intimate conversations and company. The bouncer saw us standing and offered to sit us on their large wrap around seating area in the front even though there were only 2 of us. He said, as long as it's not reserved it's open to all! From bouncer to bartender I had great service experience. And they definitely have drinks that satisfy the taste buds and get you in the mood for a great night out! I definitely will be returning!
author: Janelle S.

description:
Amazing new cocktail bar in the Mission, served by super friendly bartenders who know their stuff. The cocktails are delicious and potent, but reasonably priced ($10-11). My favorites were the Never Winter (thick and creamy, made with a thick sweet potato syrup) and "The Dude" (a spiked horchata, better than any virgin or spiked horchata I've ever had). Happy hour is Mon-Fri (5-8PM) $4 beer | $4 well | $1 off everything else. A surprisingly extensive happy hour probably to promote their newly established business. 

They offer a variety of cocktails, numerous beers on tap and by the bottle, and a range of nicer liquors by the glass. Definitely an awesome spot to come for a drink. Unfortunately no food or bar bites served, but they provide complimentary pretzels.

Several tables in the back and bar seats. Credit card accepted!
author: Jess C.

description: Made it here on a cocktail-run in the Mission last week, and really loved the vibe. They had a really cool projector showing San Francisco, and some nice music. For the drinks, I can not recall the exact names but one was peachy (great for a fruit loving drinker) and one was vodka-y (for the alcohol loving drinker).
author: Nikita K.

description:
To lift a quote from Gertrude Stein: "there is no there there." Stein was referring to her childhood home being demolished for an industrial park, and so too with Bond, a perfectly generic bar with nothing in particular to recommend it replacing Esta Noche. This is not Bond's fault, per se, but it's a tough act to follow. 

I've really tried to find something interesting, unique or special about Bond.  I'm sorry. I've got nothing. Drinks are adequate if a bit pricey, music is on the loud side but inoffensive, and the ambiance... could be worse, I guess? Sorry to damn you with faint praise, Bond, but you're just not that good and not that memorable.
author: Aaron Y.

description: I've been a couple of times, including on a Thursday night. Hands down some of the rudest, most stuck up bartenders I ever encountered.
author: Pjay E.

description: This bar is small but cute. I didn't really get to explore much of the space itself, since I spent the entire time at a small booth off to the side of the front door. From there, you can't see much besides the guard's back and anyone entering, making it a decently secluded space. I was able to enjoy a nice conversation and some intimate moments while sipping away at a strawberry gin cocktail (with strawberry ice - loved it!). Fond memories and a nice segue to the evening.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Am I going to Blondie's or Elbo Room for dancing? ABV, Double Dutch, Sycamore, or Kilowatt with friends? Probably, ya. But first (sometimes second) I'm going to Bond. The drinks are always delicious, strong, lovely, and the prices aren't bad. 

And the bathrooms are clean. 

Weekends are usually a little crazy, but fun, and the scene isn't too young or obnoxious (compared to a lot of the Mission bars, anyway). Weekday nights are often quieter, but still busy. The decor is a little on the classy side, and though it does seem to attract a lot of the bourgeois crowd, I always bring my own group of friends rather than going there to meet new people.

Did I mention that the bathrooms are clean?

I appreciate how little an effort is made to be a pseudo-dive bar hipster destination. Sometimes you don't want your feet to stick to the floor when you walk into a bar. You want to feel like the place is cared about by the owners.

Also, clean bathrooms.

I've had the strawberry gimlet that everyone seems to love, and it was good. There's also a drink I can't remember the name of where they plop a bunch of basil in, and it is refreshing and totally delicious. The Richmond is probably my favorite. I keep ordering it despite the high probability that it has been the primary cause of at least two mild hangovers. Every cocktail I've tried has been really good, and they have a great selection of top-shelf booze.

And the bathrooms have always been clean ;).
author: Christopher L.

description: The bar is a 5/5 for ambiance. The drinks are a solid 3/5 for selection and interest, the service is a 1/5. Just so painfully slow.
author: Alison H.

description:
Swanky bar that has great drinks! Loved the vibe and atmosphere. Our group ventured here on a Saturday night and while all the seats were taken, there was plenty of room to stand and not feel over crowded. Tried the strawberry gimlet and it was delicious! I would definitely come back to try more of the cocktails!  


Note: $20 minimum on credit cards
author: Noelle H.

description:
I was so excited to try Bond Bar, but I was disappointed. My friend and I came here on a Friday night, and there were two gigantic birthday parties going on, which was fine, except we realized that the bouncers allow WAY too many people in the facility at once. The two of us were sitting at a side table along the wall, and people kept bumping into us, because the bar was too many people deep. How frustrating!

Plus the drinks are not very strong, though I will admit that the bartenders are very attentive, even when there is a mob of people trying to get their attention. However they take forever to make and pay for... it's just not worth it. For $10 per cocktail the price isn't bad, but I'm more than willing to pay a little more for better service and a better atmosphere.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Based on the reviews, Bond looks to be a brand new spot in the Mission.

I stumbled in here randomly right before my New Years Eve festivities, and I was pleasantly surprised at the aesthetics of the venue.

From the unfinished solid wood bar, the arched lit "canopy" facade, the soft, warm color temperature of all the lighting, and even down to its name, Bond is best described as "tastefully hipster."

Additionally, the drink prices were fair, the music was legit, and we were even served complementary bar snacks. It's even just a hop and skip away from the 16th and Mission BART!

I'll definitely be back to Bond the next time I'm in the area.
author: William C.

description:
Finally made it into Bond and I am now mad it has taken me so long.  I went there with a group of friends for a Mission Pub Crawl and we started at Bond and never left.  We finally have a nice bar in the Mission.  The remodel is amazing with a great long bar with some lounge seating in the back of the bar and clean bathrooms.  The large monitor plays some cool stuff and I was told if there is a big game, they will play it.  

Well made cocktails with fresh ingredients that don't take a long time to make all at a great price. The bartenders are very friendly and treat you like if you were a regular.  What more can you ask for?

This is my go to bar now in the Mission!
author: Vince P.

description: Came to this bar for my birthday last night and was pleasantly surprised. It wasn't that crowded (although it was Wednesday night). We ordered drinks at the bar (strawberry gimlet and mine was tequila/rosemary/grapefruit juice) and sat in the back near the giant projector screen.
author: Katie P.

description: Made reservations (which were free!) for my graduation celebration and I was so happy with the service and ambiance. Good music and it was easy to get a drink at the bar. Very attentive staff...oh, and they also served us a round of shots on the house! That's unheard of for bars/lounges in SF. Bond better keep this going!
author: Mina D.

description:
This is a beautiful looking bar in a renovated space on 16th.  From the covered up sign outside, and what I remember of that corner, I fell like it used to be super seedy in here.  You can't tell anymore though.  And that was my only issue with it.  I understand its new, but it is still very sterile. I hope that with time it develops a personality. 

But for now, you can come here and enjoy great drinks.  They have an extensive drink menu and a very well stocked bar.  The bartenders know what they are doing.   Good happy hour too! Until 8 on weekdays! 

Not your typical Mission Bar, you can tell they are aiming higher. 

P.s.  The Time-lapse video projected on the wall is beautiful, but don't look at it too long as the steady shaking in the video can give you a headache.
author: Veasna H.

description: This is one of the most lit bars in the mission I've been to. Staff is friendly and their drinks are really good too! I love coming here
author: Anonymous ?.

description: If you like gin and tonics don't go here. Tonic is flat and brunette bar tender lady tonight told me to suck it up and buy a four dollar tonic if I wanted a carbonated g and t. Went around the corner to casanovas. Much better this bar sucks. Big time.
author: John G.

description: Great bar in the Mission district, we went there 2 times during our short stay in San Francisco and had a great time. Very reasonably priced as well.
author: Roel V.

description:
If you respect yourself don't go here. Overpriced bs for people who have a shit ton of money and don't care they're paying for overpriced alcohol. 

$9 for a Jameson's? Really? 6$ at zeitgeist.
author: Surrly H.

description: This place is so awesome!!! Super love it. I have my coworker's 21 birthday there, but he was passed out already, sad face. But this spot is so good, I will come back again, for my favorite music and best service.suggest everybody come to have fun!!! Super love it !!! I have been several bars around, this is my favorite!!! Come!!!
author: Jane C.

description:
Sweeet! I love this place. Their cocktails are amazing too. I went there around 10:30PM a sunday night and it was a bit crowded. Well, around 11:00 it was much better and less noisy I felt like in an other places. The bartenders were very cool. My friend took a Strawberry Gin, very tasty!

$10 cocktails but yeah they worth it!
author: Lino M.

description: The watermelon basil kombucha smash cocktail is amazingly light and refreshing. Although this is a small lounge, the ambiance is intimate and service is excellent. I would definitely come back next time I am in the Mission.
author: Adrianna V.

description: I went to Bond with my husband last night (it was my first time) and the bartender, Manny, was one of the nicest people I have ever met. The service was amazing, he is a master at making drinks, and he was so informed on every cocktail on the menu. I absolutely loved the lavender fizz cocktail (he puts real lavender in it-sooo good) and Manny made some wonderful suggestions on specialty drinks based on our taste. Amazing atmosphere and exceptional service! Definitely give it a try! Ask for Manny-he rocks.
author: Lori B.

description:
Stairway to nowhere.
The ghost of esta noche.
You can't force bonding.
author: Nish N.

description:
Bond Bar is amazing. They know I love them through my photos on Instagram. Haha!

My friend and I love all their cocktails and love that if you go early enough, it's pretty quiet and relaxing. (We try to get there for HH before 6-7pm, after that, it gets REALLY crowded.) Strawberry gimlet is the fave but everything on the menu is good.

Bathrooms are pretty clean, which is rare in the Mission, and staff is super chill. 5 stars!!
author: Yuri K.

description: A friend and I came across this place while walking around, and we are sure glad we stopped by! A super comfortable lounge-like space with tasty cocktails and friendly service. It wasn't too crowded and therefore wasn't too loud. I now have another place to add to my list of great bars in the Mission!
author: Max V.

description:
Maybe actually shoot me in the face before asking me to go here ever again. 

Any "establishment" that doesn't allow hats pretty much immediately gets classified as classicist/racist in my book.

The drinks are super over priced. 
Everyone is the worst.
The crowd looks like the equivalent of a Penn State frat party.

So if that's your thing. 
Have at it. 
Get crazy!
author: Ryley P.

description:
I like this bar for the relaxed atmosphere (I've only been on quiet nights so far). 
It's clean, has cozy areas to sit with friends, or you can opt for standing since there is plenty of room at and around the bar. They play my style of music, alternative hits, at a good level so that you're not just sitting with friends yet unable to talk. They sell beers for around $6-7 and cocktails for $10 (average for San Francisco).
author: Danielle C.

description: Hella cool new Mission bar. This was a final stop on a friend's scavenger hunt birthday party a couple moons ago, and it was awesome. Very chic, cool ambiance, a definite go-to to start or end your night.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Interesting little bar in the Mission District. The drinks aren't bad, but the place is small and incredibly loud. The whole night, I had to practically scream so the person next to me could hear me.

Bonus perk: The back wall has really weird videos playing on it. The one I saw seemed almost post-apocalyptic with imagery of empty fields and the vast universe behind it. Good backdrop for when you're tired of screaming and just want to chill and stare at something.
author: Yanni L.

description:
Popped in here on Saturday night after dinner at Delfina. Has good curb appeal and looked interesting so we decided to check it out. 

The decor is awesome, but it's dark in there so leave your parents at home. The drinks are decent, just don't order a Moscow mule. I saw copper cups so I figured it would be legit but it came in a glass and was not good. At all. Everyone else enjoyed their drinks so hoping it was a fluke. 

My favorite part was the huge screen on the back wall playing time lapse videos of the city. It was memorizing. 

I'll definitely be back, just not for the Moscow mule.
author: Aggie N.

description:
I went here last weekend with some friends since I saw it was new on Yelp and had gotten fairly good reviews. I'm now going to write the review I wish I had read before going. I don't take this lightly, and I don't often post negative reviews (this is my first one-star review since joining Yelp in 2009), but the fact that the overall rating on Yelp currently stands at 4 stars and most of the reviews I've seen so far read like they're about a totally different bar than the one I visited has convinced me to take a trip to the dark side.

Bond is the bar equivalent of a Potemkin village. The location used to house a dive bar and it has since been bleached of all personality and turned into a charmless facsimile of a cocktail bar. It is prodigiously devoid of personality. 

The space is poorly laid out: a bottleneck at the bar opens up to an expanse of, well, not much. The back of the bar is a white box with a few tables and chairs, and two doors at the back to the men's and ladies' rooms (which contain one toilet apiece, so queues stretch down the walls). The sole decoration eliciting any reaction from a visitor is the looping projection on the back wall. (Yes, the back wall is barren enough for a projection.) Bond feels empty even when it's crowded thanks to the large unornamented space above guests' heads.. 

The drinks were mediocre. Although the bartender was attentive, she couldn't do anything to save the ill-conceived menu. I had a juniper pisco sour that tasted more like medicine than most things I consumed the last time I had a cold. For $10, it wasn't worth it.

On a Saturday night, the place was packed with badly dressed 23 year-olds. Which is fine, if that's your thing. But it just reinforced to me the full effect of the bar: awkward, insincere, and sadly lacking in taste.
author: Nick M.

description:
Went on a Monday night. had great service and the place was real cozy and drinks were strong. Bartenders were very nice and friendly. They burn this amazing musky inscents that is made only for this bar. Very arousing smell, which I love and wish I could get some sticks. 
Anyway the bar is great and intimate atmosphere. 
great big screen in the back playing pictures of all over SF. That is a nice touch. Ill definitely be back!
author: Tracy B.

description:
Stargazing on the back wall of beautiful time lapses, and lovely cocktails. The basil gin gimlet was delicious and refreshing, as was the strawberry version.

Cute Decor inside, plenty of space and doesn't get crowded. Room to sit. Perfect for a low key Friday night!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Great atmosphere and drinks. Strawberry gin gimlet was fantastic. So was the dark & stormy.
author: Shailey D.

description: The usual crap fest for straight san Francisco tech employees.  Won't be back.
author: Daniel A.

description: Cool, chill, friendly, not-trendy, not-overrun bar with some solid cabernet on tap. Minus one star for replacing a Latino gay bar.
author: Andrew K.

description: One of the better loungey bars I've been to. I was here on a Saturday night and it was nothing short of popping. Apparently they specialize in cocktails, which go for $10 each. Beers and shots are also available for under $10. Pretzels are complementary. I was really digging the music too. Plus, there's a projector showing starry nights and nature and stuff to set the mood.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I haven't experienced much nightlife in the Mission besides late night trips to El Farolito's, but it was a gf's birthday and she wanted to check Bond out.

The bar is next to another bar that plays fairly loud hip hop/top40 type of music which I like when I'm out and about, but you can hear it for days.

For it being a Friday night around peak hours (11-12), bar was not that crowded at all. We were able to order drinks and got them within reasonable time and price ($10 avg). The Strawberry Gimlet and Zoba (?) are good drinks to start with since they're tasty but also not too weak. Plus you get complimentary pretzels as a bar snack.

Ambiance was chill; there is a projector screen displaying a time lapse of the nightskys and cute chairs to sit on in the back. The music that night was also reminiscent of middle school days (Postal Service/indie playlist). 

Since it's a new bar, everything is still clean and neat. Hopefully it stays that way.
author: Diana H.

description:
Oh. My. God. The amount of people they let into this tiny place was ridiculous. There was a birthday party going on here and they were rowdy, pushy, and so loud. They should have been limited to that back room but instead they sprawled over, knocking over me and my friend's drinks and into our small table. 

The bartender messed up my friends drink and it took a long time to get them out. One of them was too busy flirting with one of the older men standing nearby to take orders. 

Cocktails were $10, which isn't bad for SF, but out of the 4 we had, nothing impressed.
author: Winnie T.

description:
I'm a little in love with this place. 

The space is a narrow-ish bar, but with plenty of room to get through to an open lounge area in back. The back wall is a large projected screen, which I particularly enjoyed for watching the game. The bartenders were all awesome, the drinks were phenomenal (TWO spicy tequila drinks!), and the crowd was a really good mix of different crowds. I will definitely hang here again.
author: Monika M.

description:
I stopped in on a cold Saturday on a random recommendation.   The front of the building is still "under redecoration" - at first I thought it was closed, then I was concerned it was a "shabby bar."
So glad that did not stop me from venturing inside.  It looks completely redone with a very attractive bar-back area and 3 kinds of seating options (at least).   The back area has a video projection which was showing a space station earth view during my stay.  Good basic music.  
I had the Bond Sazerac and it was very good.  It has a little St Georges Pear (brandy?) liquor to change it up (but not St Georges Absinthe, go figure).  
This places seems to be off to a good start in a busy area.
author: Rum J.

description:
Franchise potential.

With good movies: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Bond_in_film

With good cocktails: House specialties for $10 include a sweet bourbon with honey concoction. Unlike the namesake the title escapes me. But it was good.

Add in a beautiful long wood bar, friendly staff and plenty of tables for a dimly lit escape and you have the makings of a bar with a loyal following.

Like the oversized letters above the entrance:

XO Bond.
author: Jason B.

description: Walked in, good scene, fancy dress, upscale international scene, fun blue cube tables, nice moving image of San Francisco, the bridge and the fog on the wall.
author: Nani B.

description: Nice bartenders and great drinks. Lots of history in this building and interesting to see new interpretation of it as bar in mission.
author: T D.

description: Cool vibe with shots of New York on a projector screen and dim lighting. Had a bourbon concoction and the bartenders were on point. Close to bart and had a nice scene. I'd definitely go back to try more cocktails.
author: Lauren K.

description: I like the new place!  Esta Noche was old and gross and this is a welcome addition.  I had a spicy drink - I forget the name - but it was a good time.  Not too spicy, but good enough.  I'll be back!
author: Shaun W.

description: Heather was my bartender and rocked it. Made me and my husband amazing custom drinks, listened to me chat and shared her own stories and overall was great. This place was clean, yummy and a must go to. There is no signage so follow the address and look for unmarked building.
author: Tiffanie H.

description: Very modern and trendy decor. Good drink list. Yet such an aloof feel. Service with a forced smile. Non engaging. Not really a fun mission feel.  Patrons attached to their devices, me included. Miss me mission dives of old!
author: Henry B.

description:
Stumbled upon this hidden gem this past weekend and I'm glad I did! 

Spacious and they have an area where you can actually groove if you're feeling it. They have white candles lit everywhere- insert heart eyes emoji here. Definitely gives you an intimate feeling and lives up to the name. Great place to bond, literally. :) 

My hands are always cold so I was so excited when they had hot water in the girl's bathroom when I was washing my hands. Love!

Took off a star because the ambiance could use a lil makeover. The place has so much history and has potential to be a gorgeous place but decors on the wall are all the same color so it blends in- a bit mundane IMO. Maybe if they paint some of the decor on the walls, the place would pop more. 

Overall a cool venue. Would definitely come back!
author: JY H.

description:
The name's Bond.

I really enjoy what they have done with this space. It is definitely a modern, hipster mission bar but it has a great vibe. I came here both on a busy Friday night and a slow week night and enjoyed both experiences. There is a projector screen all the way in the back that plays various nature scenes, which is a little strange but whatev. The bathrooms are really nice which is always a great bonus for a bar. 

The beer selection is pretty decent and they make good cocktails. There is a $20 minimum on credit cards so be sure to have cash with you. If you're in the Mission you should always carry cash! From the outside you can't really tell this place exists, especially when the streets are busy on the weekends. Overall, a cool and swanky place to grab a drink if you're in the hood!
author: Mandy A.

description: Really good gimlets and accommodating service people! Got drawn in with the huge projection screen showing earth from space and stayed for everything else. So glad they changed this place into what it is now!
author: Lily S.

description: They have a good selection of drinks. We had a birthday party here and it was pretty cool. The staff was very accommodating too. The ambience sweet and private when there's not too much crowd.
author: Aditya P.

description:
Bond is an uncrowded, yet super regular bar.

Gone are the divey vibes and drag shows of Esta Noche, in it's place is Bland-I mean, Bond. Atmosphere is nothing more than average, but the place isn't packed on weekends (yet?). There was a big booth in the back that would be awesome if it's reserve-able for groups and a bizarre projector playing the night sky.

Good value (5 beers for under $25) and room to sit down. It just lacks any real personality. We'll come by from time to time but won't be making any trips out of the way.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This bar is still pretty new so maybe that's why they don't have a sign up in the front? I was so confused haha...since yelp's address for it led me to a shady alley at first.

The decor inside was really nice and intimate with dim lights and candles. They had a projected image of a sky and stars on the wall in the back plus bar seating in the front and comfy sitting area in the back. It's the perfect place to take someone on a date!

The cocktails were surprisingly good and quite strong. Loved them! I don't remember the specific names, but the four drinks we got were very well-made. I want to try the strawberry gimlet next time though! Their ice cubes have strawberries in them!
author: Kelly T.

description: Love the atmosphere! If you want a break from a dive bar but don't feel like leaving the mission.
author: Marie S.

description:
I went there around 7PM on a Thursday, and the vibe was really great. The music wasn't too loud (and really good!), the ambiance was friendly, and the bartenders were skilled. I had a Pisco Sour and a Strawberry Gimlet. I highly recommend the latter -- it's got a strawberry inside an ice cube, and tastes great. The Pisco Sour was a bit too sour for my liking, but I'm sure someone would enjoy it.

I also found that the clientele were really friendly. It really fits the "bonding" theme of the bar. As I said, the music is good and (importantly!) not too loud, which makes it really easy to have a good conversation with friends or friendly strangers. All in all a very good time, and highly recommended if you're in the area.
author: Rahul B.

description:
Great new place with a remodeled interior. You can miss this place from the outside but just look for the door numbers from nearby stores to get to the Bond. It's situated at a corner in the middle of the block. 

The cocktail menu list a lot of delicious drinks along with wine, beer, hard liquor. I recommend the strawberry gimlet. They have strawberries inside their ice cubes! Creative.

There are a few tables in the back, one in the front and the bar area for sitting. Lots of standing room. Definitely a spot to check out in your bar-hop journey in the Mission District.
author: Nancy N.

description: Great place! I've been to the prior place that this place replaced. The old place was super creepy and made the space incredibly small. Now Bond has taken advantage of all the space it could get! The drinks are great, the back wall has the constant movie running, and its a pretty "chill" neighborhood spot. Going back very soon!
author: Robert E.

description: Overall, a great bar in the Mission, but it's definitely not a "wow" bar - if that makes sense. It's a good place to meet up with friends, have a drink or two and then head somewhere else. The Mission is typically grungy, hipster and somewhat dive-y. Bond is a bit more upscale than most bars in the area, but still has that hipster vibe. Good prices, too!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Okay drinks and okay atmosphere. Got a Moscow Mule that wasn't cold and a spicy margarita that was nicely spicy but too sweet and no where near limey enough.

My guess is this place struggles with the artisan cocktail crowd. Nouveau missionites will go to ABV, Orbit Room or a fancy restaurant like Urchin.

Too expensive and too trying to be fancy for the dive bar crowd.

Kinda missing everything. Maybe three stars is generous?
author: Raj T.

description: Friendly and responsive staff. Communication was easy to reserve some space last minute for a Friday night party of 12. The drinks were tasty and awesome huge screen to view the Warriors game!  Totally wasn't expecting to see the game on when we walked into the bar.  Definitely will be here again. The only pain was the parking but it's the Mission but this location is so easy to get to via so that's an option.
author: Maria V.

description: A great addition to bars in La Mission- shout out to one of the bartenders Jenna who was amazing. This spot is definitely a must, stop by if you're looking for a new place to hang out, especially to check out their cool projection screen!
author: Carina D.

description: Went in on a very hot day! Was looking forward to a good cocktail but all I had a pretty mediocre drink here. My wife liked her drink, was quite spicy but overall experience was crappy. Would recommend the other bars across the street more than this place. $10+ for a crappy cocktail is not worth it!
author: Michael L.

description: Wait, a bar with a friendly bar tender, serving up ridiculously delicious cocktails in the Mission? Yes please. And let's just say that if I have any more of these strawberry gimlets, I'm going to have to ask the strawberry suspended in the big cube to move in with me.
author: Justin S.

description: Great neighborhood mission bar with a delicious cocktail program and friendly staff!! The location is great; right next to a ton of amazing restaurants. A definite stop the next time you find yourself in the mission!!
author: Ashley H.

description: This place used to be a great Latino gay bar. Now it is a waste of space with over priced drinks and bad music. If they would have live music or a dj and play sports it would be excellent. You can see the boring traffic report they call art from anyplace in the bar. Imagine if that were the Giants or warriors game...just go to skylark and wait in line for a better time.
author: Andrea G.

description: Bond is my go-to happy hour or weeknight date spot. It's calm and classy, and I really like the drink selection - the bold cuban is my favorite so far. The bartenders are super chill but still super efficient. On the weekends it's waaaaay too 'untz untz untz' for my taste and gets absolutely packed with kids in button downs and stilettos.
author: Rachel M.

description: Strong drinks which made $20 min on cards so worth it. Less than friendly bar tender. Great place for small groups.
author: Ashley T.

description: My local bar and I love the decor and lighting.  A real bar for anyone, any age.  Flock wall paper and arch over the bar, fantastic.  Yesterday was my third visit and the tonic was flat in our G&Ts.  The bar man did replace but was all a bit of an effort.  All the tables at the back were 'reserved' forcing everyone to the front to make the place look busy at 5pm (a cheap trick?).
