I know its the holiday season and the bar staff are tired and would rather be somewhere else, but do they have to show it.  Bit more interested in themselves than in the customers, was the impression I got.  Shame, as 'liked this bar very much.  Can't see it lasting with this amount of competition close by.
author: Michael D.

description: Fantastic craft cocktails!! I love to go out my name in at a restaurant in Valencia then head here for a drink or two while waiting for my table. Also a huge benefit--they allow dogs!
author: Mac C.

description: Bar hopping on a Monday night with my friends and i came in already tipsy. I remember trying the strawberry gimlet and it was delicious. The place is cool and spacious . Towards the back of the lounge had teacup candles +low lighting throughout the hallway makes it look cozy and more romantic is a plus. My experience here was very enjoyable.
author: Megan L.

description: It's in my neighborhood, it's clean and spacious.  The fancy cocktails are plenty.  The standard drinks are small and pack a very light punch.  I call a vodak soda or a gin and tonic- a regular drink.  I wont seek this out again, but give it a three because it's not offensive.
author: Rochelle K.

description: Came here after an improv show with my two homies who know the area and they can just drink and talk for hours so if they like this place I trust them. It's a dim lit bad with big romantic velvet seats in the back with beautiful videos of San Francisco scenery playing in the background. Good mix of music too :). Bartender is awesome and he gave us drinks and talked with us.  Had a special drink with Bourbon, Ginger, Lime, and Mint!
author: Kristin C.

description: I was a big lover of all things crazy and Esta Noche, but I have accepted it is no longer here and times...they are a changing. Enter BOND,geez what a different atmosphere altogether. Swanky, dark,beautifully decorated. Great drink quality, my margarita was refreshing on a hot day. My friend got a Moscow Mule which looked very untraditional (i.e no copper mug),but he said it was really good. I definitely will be back ,be aware though it's on the expensive side.
author: Lauren V.

description: The first bar you'll hit walking up 16th from BART, if you don't count El Tin Tan (which is intended for a different crowd). Seems designed to siphon off bridge-and-tunnel traffic before it gets to Skylark or Blondies. Lounge-y, characterless. If a clean, cavernous space is what you seek, you'll do fine here.
author: Armin T.

description: The strawberry gimlet comes with a large ice cube with a frozen strawberry in it. The drink itself is tasty and refreshing, not too sweet. It's a little pricey for the quantity of beverage you get, but the strawberry ice cube is a gimmick I totally fall for. The night we went was fairly empty and we got a huge spacious booth in the back. Seems like a great place to take someone on a first date.
author: Amy Y.

description: Awesome cocktails - just the right strength, really unique, very delicious.  You really can't go wrong with the menu, all our friends were very happy.
author: Jessica H.

description: Amazing bar!!!!superb ambiance and delicious cocktails!!!!! Totally worth it!!!!! Fav cocktail Bold Cuban!
author: amy h.

description: Fun new bar in the mission. It looks like a little hole in the wall from the outside. The interior was remodeled very well. It looks so vintage you can appreciate the architecture of the building. The drinks were awesome! Great mixology happening here.
author: Natalia H.

description: Great ambiance, great drinks, fun staff.  I will say that the two bartenders each made the spicy Marg differently which was interesting. Luckily both had the right amount of alcohol which is what matters most.
author: Michael S.

description: Drinks were delicious! The ambiance is nice and romantic. I enjoyed the projector images very much, it really ads to the sultry ambiance. Very happy to see this new addition in the neighborhood. We will definitely be back to try more cocktails!
author: Chauanh D.

description: It's not Esta Noche, and it isn't supposed to be.  Times change and this new venue is pretty fun.  I enjoy this vibe too. Candle lit, sophisticated mission I would call it.  The bartenders are smart and engaging.  I love a dive as much as anyone but I can come here too meet some nice people and still enjoy the place with the nostalgia of its past.  Bathrooms are a lot better than  before, for those who remember the men's room of the prior bar.
author: Ryan M.

description: Awesome addition to the mission , bartenders ( they all make sure that you have been served even if they have ti ask twice , great vibe and don't expect the same crowd that goes to delirium or blondie's , this way place has way more class ( no offense ). ABV And Bond  wonderful new spots in the mission .
author: NAEL K.

description: This place is owned by the people who own WISH in SOMA, and I love that place so I thought I would check it out after sushi. It's BEAUTIFUL! And like Wish the bar staff is friendly and make great drinks. I had a spicy drink and it had the perfect amount of warmth. The place is just a cool place to hang out and have a drink with a friend and not get overwhelmed with overly loud music and douchebags.
author: Jenoa H.

description: Awesome bar. Great ambiance. The Desperado is a must order. Mescal with carpano and some other delish mix. When you order use the code "Third Floor" for the JY Special.
author: Jason Y.

description: Cool place! SF images projected onto the back wall which is cool. Wasn't too crowded for a Friday night.
author: Jonathan D.

description: Nice and spacious place. Cocktails are good, but not great. Bartenders are very friendly.
author: Tracey W.

description: Great new(er) spot in the mission. My boyfriend and I live close by and finally had the chance to check it out last weekend. The building is historic which was cool, still keeping some of its roots. The atmosphere was laid back and the cocktails were excellent, although they did manage to screw up a dirty martini. Overall had a great time and can't wait to go back.
author: Katelyn B.

description: Good drinks and quickest service. Visited early in the evening so was expected to be quick service and got a good table. Nothing that impressive by the actual bar though or the quality of drinks.
author: Livia M.

description: Great to see a new bar in the neighborhood as the bar that was there before was a dump!   Stumbled in here on Saturday night and had a couple beers, which they had a good selection.  My friend had the negroni cocktail which she loved.   Since its brand new they still need a bit more furniture which I'm sure they'll fix, but they had some cool video art on the back wall.
author: DC T.

description: Cool ambiance, it was quiet enough that you could actually talk to people and there are nice booths for groups to sit in, friendly bartender, solid selection of bottle and tap beers and ok prices ($5 for most drafts). Well drinks were kinda pricey, but we didn't go for happy hour so can't comment on that.
author: Nishant S.

description: A great venue and new lease on life for this vintage SF historical landmark - big beautiful arch over bar which was once the front desk for a hotel way back in the day.  Warm/comfortable atmosphere with great drinks and a serious sound system (count the number of subwoofers as you walk in).
author: Dan B.

description: My favorite new bar in the Mission! Great staff, amazing space. Check this place out before it blows up and you can't get in.
author: Adrienne D.

description: represents the dramatic changes of the mission neighborhood, once catering to people more on the fringes, now transitioning into a gentrified hipster locale.
author: Rob C.

description: can't wait to visit SF again.. and this place is one the reasons why! nice and beautiful people, great music, delicious and refreshing drinks and of course the back wall...
author: Rhea E.

description: brought some friends to bond. very nice staff, friendly bartender! nice vibe in this easy-to-miss bar on 16th. but younger crowd, but a good stop-in.  I'll be back to say hey.
author: Roy N.

description: This bar is great! It must be new because it feels like a hidden gem :). My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this bar and ended up staying for multiple cocktails. I'd recommend it in a heart beat!
author: Amanda G.
